subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Sam Querrey, the top seed, was upset in the second round of the Hall of Fame Tennis Championships in Newport, R.I., extending the No. 1 seed’s run of never winning the title in the 34 years of the tournament.
snippet: Sam Querrey, the top seed, was upset in the second round of the Hall of Fame Tennis Championships in Newport, R.I., extending the No. 1 seed’s run of never winning the title in the 34 years of the tournament.
